text: hey my name is Joey and I'm a data
warehouse specialist solution architect
and the Amazon redshift team with over
200 features and capabilities added in
last 18 months
Amazon redshift continues to innovate to

demo I will cover Amazon redshift
materialized reviews a feature that was
previewed at Greenland 2019 and is now
generally available when tearless views
is a well known concept for data
warehouses specifically for use cases
such as dashboards and the EIT
processing that require interactive
speeds for complex analytical queries
including math portable drawings and
aggregations with support for
materialized views Amazon redshift
provides significantly faster query
performance for repeated and predictable
workloads materialized views are defined
with a select query over one or more
base tables and persists the result of
the query as the data comes in you
refresh the materialized view once and
query eight many times you can
materialize joins futures aggregations
and more which speeds user queries by
order of magnitude as compared to
executing them over base tables
materialized views with supported sicko
can be incrementally refresh this means
that if you are adding a few rows to
your base table we could only use this
new data to update the materialized view
instead of recomputing the entire view
every time at the same time the Refresh
is user triggered which gives you the
flexibility to choose one to refresh the
data based on your need
now let's go over an example to learn
how you can start using mochilas views
here I have a product review dataset
which has a hundred fifty million
records from customer across United
States using these trackers I like to
find out in which state customers are
more interested in my products
especially in the home and grocery
category first I created a query by
drawing this dataset with customer and
customer address tables and Counting
customer review per product category and
stained this query takes more than four
seconds to complete to accelerate such
queries I create a materialist view that
pre computes the count of reviews now my
query takes less than 100 milliseconds
redshift mature less view can also be
efficiently refreshed for example let's
add another 10,000 product reviews to
the base table now my metier s view is
out to date however they just take a
refresh and in less than 200
milliseconds the mature as views is up
to date again it would take about four
seconds more to recompute a regular view
from scratch materialist view is much
faster because it could be incremental
we only use the new data to update the
mature s views instead of recomputing
the entire view again from base tables
to summarize mature s views can be
defined on a single table or a drawing
of multiple tables query can be orders
of magnitude faster when using
materialized view and materialized views
can be efficiently refreshed
